content: Boy shot with BB gun declared brain-dead LAGUNA HILLS – The family of a 15-year-old boy is mourning the loss of a son, brother and grandson as authorities struggle to figure out how the teenager ended up shot in the head with his own BB gun. Michael Chen was pronounced dead at 8:15 p.m. Tuesday at Children's Hospital of Orange County at Mission Hospital, two days after his mother and grandmother found him unconscious in the family's backyard. Chen had been shot in the temple – but how and why are the subject of a sheriff's investigation. Authorities are waiting for autopsy results to help shed light on whether Chen was the victim of a tragic shooting accident or if he intentionally shot himself. Full article ... >http://www.ocregister.com/articles/boy-sheriff-orange-2324778-pellet-county This is very strange, I've never heard of something like this before.

Chen had been shot in the temple – but how and why are the subject of a sheriff's investigation. Authorities are waiting for autopsy results to help shed light on whether Chen was the victim of a tragic shooting accident or if he intentionally shot himself. title: Very strange; Boy shot with BB gun declared brain-dead

content: It just points up that human beings are fairly fragile, too. Even something as inconsequential as a bb can kill if it hits the right spot. Gun safety should be taught with cap pistols. There are a number of one-eyed folk around because of that 'toy'. The aprocryphal old warning 'you'll put somebody's eye out with that thing' applies to a number of human activities.

content: Nothing strange about it. There was also a case about 20+ years ago about someone skylarking with a weapon loaded with blanks between takes on the set of a popular TV show. Shot himself in the head with a blank round. He didn't survive.

content: Well damn, better put a gun ban on all BB guns. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

title: Very strange; Boy shot with BB gun declared brain-dead

content: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: Well damn, better put a gun ban on all BB guns. First thing I did with mine was bounce bbs off my brother's plastic army helmet, with him in it. Shot myself up the arm on Christmas afternoon when it jammed. And busted it before I even got it. 5 years of asking 'Santa' for a BBgun and I was nowhere near ready for it. Maybe no ban, but restricted age and supervision required.
quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: Well damn, better put a gun ban on all BB guns.
reply: First thing I did with mine was bounce bbs off my brother's plastic army helmet, with him in it. Shot myself up the arm on Christmas afternoon when it jammed. And busted it before I even got it. 5 years of asking 'Santa' for a BBgun and I was nowhere near ready for it. Maybe no ban, but restricted age and supervision required.

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: It just points up that human beings are fairly fragile, too. Even something as inconsequential as a bb can kill if it hits the right spot. Gun safety should be taught with cap pistols. There are a number of one-eyed folk around because of that 'toy'. The aprocryphal old warning 'you'll put somebody's eye out with that thing' applies to a number of human activities. I use to have BB guns "battles" with my friends as a kid. Goes to show when your that age...nothing can hurt you. This is a tragic freak accident and things like this will always happen no matter what. Like you say we are very fragile. In fact, as soon as we born everything is out to take us out. RIP son.
